If you attempt--in dress, in the ordering of your house, in your manners--to be English, you will have a very little influence. Act out the American. No one expects you to act an Englishman. No one will respect you any more for adopting English speech, English hours, English customs. Just carry all the Americanism you can into your England Mission, and let England 


                                    -106- 

see you are not at all ashamed to stand under the Stars and Stripes.--Letter 40, 1879, pp. 6, 7. (To J. N. Loughborough, circa 1879.)
